title: Infrastructure Resilience & Debugging Workflow
summary: When production shows white screen but build passes locally, CHECK HOSTING PROVIDER STATUS FIRST before debugging code.

incident.symptom: b0b.dev showing white screen after deploy
incident.initial_assumption: React hydration error or component bug
incident.time_wasted: ~30 minutes debugging code that was working fine
incident.detection: Screenshot of Railway dashboard showing GitHub rate limit banner

learnings.title: Check infrastructure status FIRST
learnings.description: Before debugging code, check: Railway status, GitHub status, DNS, CDN
learnings.action: Add status checks to debugging workflow

learnings.title: Local works ≠ Production works
learnings.description: If build passes locally and site renders locally, issue is likely deployment/hosting
learnings.action: Always test locally before assuming code is broken

learnings.title: Don't debug by disabling features one-by-one
learnings.description: Inefficient to remove components, rebuild, deploy, test. Wastes time and creates messy git history
learnings.action: Run locally first, check logs, check provider status

learnings.title: Need backup deployment targets
learnings.description: Single point of failure with Railway. Need Vercel/Cloudflare as backup
learnings.action: Set up Vercel as secondary deployment

learnings.title: Need uptime monitoring
learnings.description: Should be alerted when sites go down, not discover via manual check
learnings.action: Set up UptimeRobot or similar for all domains

action_items.task: Set up Vercel as backup deployment for dashboard
Create uptime monitoring for b0b.dev, d0t.b0b.dev, 0type.b0b.dev
Document debugging workflow: local test → provider status → then code debug
Add Dockerfile for self-hosted fallback option
Subscribe to status pages: status.railway.app, githubstatus.com
